CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Depends : Visual Basic 6. Service Pack 5, or higher is recommended.
*' Purpose : Provides a test environment for the VBLayers ActiveX Control
*' Notes : This sample form provides examples of some, but not all of the features supported by this version of
*' VBLayers. Please refer to the included documentation, vblayers.xml, for a breakdown of the complete
*' For more access to the data inside of the control, try declaring a variable array of type
*' LAYER_ITEM and setting its value to the snapshot property of the control. Changes will be reflected
*' immediately when reassigning the LAYER_ITEM array back to the snapshot property.

Reference.Name: VBRUN
Reference.Description: Visual Basic runtime objects and procedures

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Depends : Visual Basic 6. Service Pack 5, or higher is recommended.
*' Purpose : Provide a single layer item for use in a layer dialog control. Example: Adobe Photoshop.
*' Notes : This component is fairly straightforward. There is minimal functionality in here, except for providing
*' the toggling of the custom "check boxes". Most of the rest of this control acts as an event broker
*' for raising events to the LayerWindow. Private in Scope.

Procedure.Name: AddLayer

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Add a new layer to the LayerWindow
*' Input : LayerName - Name of the layer.
*' Visible - Whether the control is visible.
*' Locked - Whether the control is locked.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Sub AddLayer(LayerName As String, Visible As Boolean, Locked As Boolean)

Procedure.Name: GetLockedState

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Determine if an item is locked, by its name.
*' Input : LayerName - Name of layer to check.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Function GetLockedState(LayerName As String) As Boolean

Procedure.Name: GetVisibilityState

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Determine if an item is locked, by its name.
*' Input : LayerName - Name of layer to check.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Function GetVisibilityState(LayerName As String) As Boolean

Procedure.Name: MoveLayer

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Move a layer to the position of an existing layer.
*' Input : CurrentLayer - Name of the layer to move.
*' Placement - Name of the layer to place at.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Sub MoveLayer(CurrentLayer As String, Placement As String, PlaceAfter As Boolean)

Procedure.Name: RemoveLayer

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Remove a layer from the LayerWindow
*' Input : LayerName - Name of the layer to remove, or if no layer is named, the currently selected layer.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Sub RemoveLayer(Optional LayerName As String = vbNullString)

Procedure.Name: RenameLayer

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Rename a layer to a newly named layer.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Sub RenameLayer(LayerName As String, NewLayerName As String)

Procedure.Name: SelectedLayer

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Get the name of the currently selected layer.
*' Output : SelectedLayer - Name of the layer that is currently selected.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Function SelectedLayer() As String

Procedure.Name: ForceUpdatePos

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Provides a fix for a known VB Behavioral issue. When use ReleaseCapture() and SendMessage() to move
*' a control, VB does not update .Left and .Top properties of the control.
*' Input : ctlUnknown - Any object of having a Type of Control

Procedure.Declaration: Private Sub ForceUpdatePos(ctlUnknown As Control)

Procedure.Name: GetDropIndex

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Get the index of a completed drag operation's target.
*' Input : Index - Index of control that is being dropped.

Procedure.Declaration: Private Function GetDropIndex(Index As Long) As Long

Procedure.Name: IsButtonDown

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Retrieve state of mouse button.
*' Input : Button - Button to check for being pressed

Procedure.Declaration: Private Function IsButtonDown(ByVal Button As MouseButtonConstants) As Boolean

Procedure.Name: PopLayer

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Pop a layer into a given index.
*' Input : CurrentIndex - Index of current layer.
*' NewIndex - The Index it should have when it is done.

Procedure.Declaration: Private Function PopLayer(CurrentIndex As Long, NewIndex As Long)

Procedure.Name: ResizeLayerItems

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Match the width of the layer items to the containing control.

Procedure.Declaration: Private Sub ResizeLayerItems()

Procedure.Name: GetIndexByName

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Purpose : Retrieve the index of an item, based on the name that is passed.
*' Input : strName - Name of the layer to look for.
*' Output : GetIndexByName - Long Index of Item, if exists. -1 on no match.

Procedure.Declaration: Private Function GetIndexByName(strName As String) As Long

CommentLines.CommentLine: *' Depends : Visual Basic 6.0 or Higher, SP5
*' Purpose : Provide a Photoshop-esque layer control for those wishing to have a way to manage layers in their
*' Notes : 1. IMPORTANT! For those who want more functionality than is provided with the interface of the
*' control, a snapshot of the internal data structure can be retrieved as a property value, modified,
*' and placed back live. The reason for doing this is that this control will server many different
*' needs for many different applications, and to allow the most use of the data by the developer is
*' a desirable feature in this situation.
*' ToDo : 1. Sync layer item top to top of container. (Minor - Display Quality)
